segment.source: Create a device account using UI (Surface Hub)
segment.target: Create a device account using UI (Surface Hub)

segment.source: If you prefer to use a graphical user interface, you can create a device account for your Microsoft Surface Hub with either the Office 365 UI or the Exchange Admin Center.
segment.target: If you prefer to use a graphical user interface, you can create a device account for your Microsoft Surface Hub with either the Office 365 UI or the Exchange Admin Center.

segment.source: Create a device account using UI (Surface Hub)
segment.target: Create a device account using UI (Surface Hub)

segment.source: If you prefer to use a graphical user interface, you can create a device account for your Microsoft Surface Hub with either the Office 365 UI or the Exchange Admin Center.
segment.target: If you prefer to use a graphical user interface, you can create a device account for your Microsoft Surface Hub with either the Office 365 UI or the Exchange Admin Center.

segment.source: Create a device account using Office 365
segment.target: Create a device account using Office 365

segment.source: Create the account in the Office 365 Admin Center.
segment.target: Create the account in the Office 365 Admin Center.

segment.source: Create a mobile device mailbox (ActiveSync) policy from the Microsoft Exchange Admin Center.
segment.target: Create a mobile device mailbox (ActiveSync) policy from the Microsoft Exchange Admin Center.

segment.source: Use PowerShell to complete device account creation.
segment.target: Use PowerShell to complete device account creation.

segment.source: Use PowerShell to configure Exchange properties of the account.
segment.target: Use PowerShell to configure Exchange properties of the account.

segment.source: Enable the account with Skype for Business.
segment.target: Enable the account with Skype for Business.

segment.source: Create the account in the Office 365 Admin Center
segment.target: Create the account in the Office 365 Admin Center

segment.source: Sign in to Office 365 by visiting http://portal.office.com/admin/
segment.target: Sign in to Office 365 by visiting http://portal.office.com/admin/

segment.source: Provide the admin credentials for your Office 365 tenant.
segment.target: Provide the admin credentials for your Office 365 tenant.

segment.source: This will take you to your Office 365 Admin Center.
segment.target: This will take you to your Office 365 Admin Center.

segment.source: office 365 admin center.
segment.target: office 365 admin center.

segment.source: Once you are at the Office 365 Admin Center, navigate to Users in the left panel, and then click Active Users.
segment.target: Once you are at the Office 365 Admin Center, navigate to Users in the left panel, and then click Active Users.

segment.source: office 365 admin center dashboard shwoing active users.
segment.target: office 365 admin center dashboard shwoing active users.

segment.source: On the controls above the list of users, click to create a new user.
segment.target: On the controls above the list of users, click to create a new user.

segment.source: You'll need to enter a Display name, User name, Password and an email address for the recipient of the password.
segment.target: You'll need to enter a Display name, User name, Password and an email address for the recipient of the password.

segment.source: Optionally you can change the password manually, but we recommend that you use the auto-generated option.
segment.target: Optionally you can change the password manually, but we recommend that you use the auto-generated option.

segment.source: You also need to assign this account a license that gives the account access to Exchange and Skype for Business services.
segment.target: You also need to assign this account a license that gives the account access to Exchange and Skype for Business services.

segment.source: screen to create a new user account.
segment.target: screen to create a new user account.

segment.source: Click Create.
segment.target: Click Create.

segment.source: Once the account has been successfully created, click Close on the resulting dialog box, and you will see the admin center Active Users list again.
segment.target: Once the account has been successfully created, click Close on the resulting dialog box, and you will see the admin center Active Users list again.

segment.source: confirmation screen for creating a new account.
segment.target: confirmation screen for creating a new account.

segment.source: Select the user you just created from the Active Users list.
segment.target: Select the user you just created from the Active Users list.

segment.source: You need to disable the Skype for Business license, because you can’t create a Skype Meeting Room with this option.
segment.target: You need to disable the Skype for Business license, because you can’t create a Skype Meeting Room with this option.

segment.source: office 365 admin center showing properties for the new user account.
segment.target: office 365 admin center showing properties for the new user account.

segment.source: In the right panel you can see the account properties and several optional actions.
segment.target: In the right panel you can see the account properties and several optional actions.

segment.source: The process so far has created a regular Skype account for this user, which you need to disable.
segment.target: The process so far has created a regular Skype account for this user, which you need to disable.

segment.source: Click Edit for the Assigned license section, then click the dropdown arrow next to the license to expand the details.
segment.target: Click Edit for the Assigned license section, then click the dropdown arrow next to the license to expand the details.

segment.source: assign license for skype for business online.
segment.target: assign license for skype for business online.

segment.source: From the list, uncheck Skype for Business Online (plan 2) (this license may vary depending on your organization), and click SAVE.
segment.target: From the list, uncheck Skype for Business Online (plan 2) (this license may vary depending on your organization), and click SAVE.

segment.source: Create a mobile device mailbox (ActiveSync) policy from the Exchange Admin Center
segment.target: Create a mobile device mailbox (ActiveSync) policy from the Exchange Admin Center

segment.source: In the Office 365 Admin Center’s left panel, click ADMIN, and then click Exchange.
segment.target: In the Office 365 Admin Center’s left panel, click ADMIN, and then click Exchange.

segment.source: office 365 admin center, showing exchange active users.
segment.target: office 365 admin center, showing exchange active users.

segment.source: This will open another tab on your browser to take you to the Exchange Admin Center, where you can create and set the Mailbox Setting for Surface Hub.
segment.target: This will open another tab on your browser to take you to the Exchange Admin Center, where you can create and set the Mailbox Setting for Surface Hub.

segment.source: exchange admin center.
segment.target: exchange admin center.

segment.source: To create a Mobile Device Mailbox Policy, click Mobile from the left panel and then click Mobile device mailbox policies.
segment.target: To create a Mobile Device Mailbox Policy, click Mobile from the left panel and then click Mobile device mailbox policies.

segment.source: Surface Hubs require an account with a mobile device mailbox policy that does not require a password, so if you already have an existing policy that matches this requirement, you can apply that policy to the account.
segment.target: Surface Hubs require an account with a mobile device mailbox policy that does not require a password, so if you already have an existing policy that matches this requirement, you can apply that policy to the account.

segment.source: Otherwise use the following steps to create a new one to be used only for Surface Hub device accounts.
segment.target: Otherwise use the following steps to create a new one to be used only for Surface Hub device accounts.

segment.source: excahnge admin center - creating a mobile device mailbox policy.
segment.target: excahnge admin center - creating a mobile device mailbox policy.

segment.source: To create a New Surface Hub mobile device mailbox policy, click the button from the controls above the list of policies to add a new policy.
segment.target: To create a New Surface Hub mobile device mailbox policy, click the button from the controls above the list of policies to add a new policy.

segment.source: For the name, provide a name that will help you distinguish this policy from other device accounts (for example, SurfaceHubDeviceMobilePolicy).
segment.target: For the name, provide a name that will help you distinguish this policy from other device accounts (for example, SurfaceHubDeviceMobilePolicy).

segment.source: Make sure the policy does not require a password for the devices assigned to, so make sure Require a Password remains unchecked, then click Save.
segment.target: Make sure the policy does not require a password for the devices assigned to, so make sure Require a Password remains unchecked, then click Save.

segment.source: image showing new mobile device policy
segment.target: image showing new mobile device policy

segment.source: After you have created the new mobile device mailbox policy, go back to the Exchange Admin Center and you will see the new policy listed.
segment.target: After you have created the new mobile device mailbox policy, go back to the Exchange Admin Center and you will see the new policy listed.

segment.source: image with new mobile device mailbox policy in exchange admin center.
segment.target: image with new mobile device mailbox policy in exchange admin center.

segment.source: Now, to apply the ActiveSync policy without using PowerShell, you can do the following: In the EAC, click RecipientsMailboxes and then select a mailbox.
segment.target: Now, to apply the ActiveSync policy without using PowerShell, you can do the following: In the EAC, click RecipientsMailboxes and then select a mailbox.

segment.source: image showing mailbox in exchange admin center.
segment.target: image showing mailbox in exchange admin center.

segment.source: In the Details pane, scroll to Phone and Voice Features and click View details to display the Mobile Device Details screen.
segment.target: In the Details pane, scroll to Phone and Voice Features and click View details to display the Mobile Device Details screen.

segment.source: image showing mobile device details for the mailbox.
segment.target: image showing mobile device details for the mailbox.

segment.source: The mobile device mailbox policy that’s currently assigned is displayed.
segment.target: The mobile device mailbox policy that’s currently assigned is displayed.

segment.source: To change the mobile device mailbox policy, click Browse.
segment.target: To change the mobile device mailbox policy, click Browse.

segment.source: image with details for the mobile device policy.
segment.target: image with details for the mobile device policy.

segment.source: Choose the appropriate mobile device mailbox policy from the list, click OK and then click Save.
segment.target: Choose the appropriate mobile device mailbox policy from the list, click OK and then click Save.

segment.source: image showing multiple mobile device mailbox policies.
segment.target: image showing multiple mobile device mailbox policies.

segment.source: Use PowerShell to complete device account creation
segment.target: Use PowerShell to complete device account creation

segment.source: From here on, you'll need to finish the account creation process using PowerShell to set up some configuration.
segment.target: From here on, you'll need to finish the account creation process using PowerShell to set up some configuration.

segment.source: In order to run cmdlets used by these PowerShell scripts, the following must be installed for the admin PowerShell console:
segment.target: In order to run cmdlets used by these PowerShell scripts, the following must be installed for the admin PowerShell console:

segment.source: Microsoft Online Services Sign-In Assistant for IT Professionals BETA
segment.target: Microsoft Online Services Sign-In Assistant for IT Professionals BETA

segment.source: Windows Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell
segment.target: Windows Azure Active Directory Module for Windows PowerShell

segment.source: Skype for Business Online, Windows PowerShell Module
segment.target: Skype for Business Online, Windows PowerShell Module

segment.source: Connecting to online services
segment.target: Connecting to online services

segment.source: Run Windows PowerShell as Administrator.
segment.target: Run Windows PowerShell as Administrator.

segment.source: image showing how to start windows powershell and run as administrator.
segment.target: image showing how to start windows powershell and run as administrator.

segment.source: Create a Credentials object, then create a new session that connects to Skype for Business Online, and provide the global tenant administrator account, then click OK.
segment.target: Create a Credentials object, then create a new session that connects to Skype for Business Online, and provide the global tenant administrator account, then click OK.

segment.source: image for windows powershell credential request.
segment.target: image for windows powershell credential request.

segment.target: To connect to Microsoft Online Services, run:

segment.target: image showing powershell cmdlet.

segment.source: Now to connect to Skype for Business Online Services, run:
segment.target: Now to connect to Skype for Business Online Services, run:

segment.target: image showing powershell cmdlet.

segment.source: Finally, to connect to Exchange Online Services, run:
segment.target: Finally, to connect to Exchange Online Services, run:

segment.target: image showing powershell cmdlet.

segment.source: Now you have to import the Skype for Business Online Session and the Exchange Online session you have just created, which will import the Exchange and Skype Commands so you can use them locally.
segment.target: Now you have to import the Skype for Business Online Session and the Exchange Online session you have just created, which will import the Exchange and Skype Commands so you can use them locally.

segment.source: Note that this could take a while to complete.
segment.target: Note that this could take a while to complete.

segment.source: image showing powershell cmdlet.
segment.target: image showing powershell cmdlet.

segment.source: Once you’re connected to the online services you need to run a few more cmdlets to configure this account as a Surface Hub device account.
segment.target: Once you’re connected to the online services you need to run a few more cmdlets to configure this account as a Surface Hub device account.

segment.source: Use PowerShell to configure Exchange properties of the account
segment.target: Use PowerShell to configure Exchange properties of the account

segment.source: Now that you're connected to the online services, you can finish setting up the device account.
segment.target: Now that you're connected to the online services, you can finish setting up the device account.

segment.source: You'll use the device account email address to:
segment.target: You'll use the device account email address to:

segment.source: Change the mailbox type from regular to room.
segment.target: Change the mailbox type from regular to room.

segment.source: Set the password and enable the room mailbox account
segment.target: Set the password and enable the room mailbox account

segment.source: Change various Exchange properties
segment.target: Change various Exchange properties

segment.source: Set the user account password to never expire.
segment.target: Set the user account password to never expire.

segment.target: You’ll need to enter the account’s mail address and create a variable with that value:

segment.target: To store the value get it from the mailbox:

segment.target: Print the value:

segment.target: You will see the correct email address.

segment.target: image showing powershell cmdlet.

segment.source: You need to convert the account into to a room mailbox, so run:
segment.target: You need to convert the account into to a room mailbox, so run:

segment.source: image showing powershell cmdlet.
segment.target: image showing powershell cmdlet.

segment.source: In order for the device account to be authenticated on a Surface Hub, you need to enable the room mailbox account and set a password, so the account can be used by the device to get meeting information using ActiveSync and log in to Skype for Business.
segment.target: In order for the device account to be authenticated on a Surface Hub, you need to enable the room mailbox account and set a password, so the account can be used by the device to get meeting information using ActiveSync and log in to Skype for Business.

segment.source: image showing powershell cmdlet.
segment.target: image showing powershell cmdlet.

segment.source: Various Exchange properties can be set on the device account to improve the meeting experience.
segment.target: Various Exchange properties can be set on the device account to improve the meeting experience.

segment.source: You can see which properties need to be set in the Exchange properties section.
segment.target: You can see which properties need to be set in the Exchange properties section.

segment.source: image showing powershell cmdlet.
segment.target: image showing powershell cmdlet.

segment.source: If you decide to have the password not expire, you can set that with PowerShell cmdlets too.
segment.target: If you decide to have the password not expire, you can set that with PowerShell cmdlets too.

segment.source: See Password management for more information.
segment.target: See Password management for more information.

segment.source: Enable the account with Skype for Business
segment.target: Enable the account with Skype for Business

segment.source: Enable the device account with Skype for Business.
segment.target: Enable the device account with Skype for Business.

segment.source: In order to enable Skype for Business, your environment will need to meet the following prerequisites:
segment.target: In order to enable Skype for Business, your environment will need to meet the following prerequisites:

segment.source: You'll need to have Lync Online (Plan 2) or higher in your O365 plan.
segment.target: You'll need to have Lync Online (Plan 2) or higher in your O365 plan.

segment.source: The plan needs to support conferencing capability.
segment.target: The plan needs to support conferencing capability.

segment.source: If you need Enterprise Voice (PSTN telephony) using telephony service providers for the Surface Hub, you need Lync Online (Plan 3).
segment.target: If you need Enterprise Voice (PSTN telephony) using telephony service providers for the Surface Hub, you need Lync Online (Plan 3).

segment.source: Your tenant users must have Exchange mailboxes.
segment.target: Your tenant users must have Exchange mailboxes.

segment.source: Your Surface Hub account does require a Lync Online (Plan 2) or Lync Online (Plan 3) license, but it does not require an Exchange Online license.
segment.target: Your Surface Hub account does require a Lync Online (Plan 2) or Lync Online (Plan 3) license, but it does not require an Exchange Online license.

segment.source: Start by creating a remote PowerShell session from a PC.
segment.target: Start by creating a remote PowerShell session from a PC.

segment.source: To enable your Surface Hub account for Skype for Business Server, run this cmdlet:
segment.target: To enable your Surface Hub account for Skype for Business Server, run this cmdlet:

segment.source: If you aren't sure what value to use for the parameter in your environment, you can get the value from an existing Skype for Business user using this cmdlet:
segment.target: If you aren't sure what value to use for the parameter in your environment, you can get the value from an existing Skype for Business user using this cmdlet:

segment.source: Create a device account using the Exchange Admin Center
segment.target: Create a device account using the Exchange Admin Center

segment.source: You can use the Exchange Admin Center to create a device account:
segment.target: You can use the Exchange Admin Center to create a device account:

segment.source: Create an account and mailbox with the Exchange Admin Center.
segment.target: Create an account and mailbox with the Exchange Admin Center.

segment.source: Create a mobile device mailbox policy from the Exchange Admin Center.
segment.target: Create a mobile device mailbox policy from the Exchange Admin Center.

segment.source: Use PowerShell to configure the account.
segment.target: Use PowerShell to configure the account.

segment.source: Enable the account with Skype for Business.
segment.target: Enable the account with Skype for Business.

segment.source: Create an account and mailbox with the Exchange Admin Center
segment.target: Create an account and mailbox with the Exchange Admin Center

segment.source: Sign in to your Exchange Admin Center using Exchange admin credentials.
segment.target: Sign in to your Exchange Admin Center using Exchange admin credentials.

segment.source: Once you are at the Exchange Admin Center (EAC), navigate to Recipients in the left panel.
segment.target: Once you are at the Exchange Admin Center (EAC), navigate to Recipients in the left panel.

segment.source: image showing mailboxes in exchange admin center.
segment.target: image showing mailboxes in exchange admin center.

segment.source: On the controls above the list of mailboxess, choose to create a new one, and provide a Display name, Name, and User logon name, and then click Save.
segment.target: On the controls above the list of mailboxess, choose to create a new one, and provide a Display name, Name, and User logon name, and then click Save.

segment.source: image showing creating a new mailbox.
segment.target: image showing creating a new mailbox.

segment.source: Create a mobile device mailbox policy from the Exchange Admin Center
segment.target: Create a mobile device mailbox policy from the Exchange Admin Center

segment.source: Note If you want to create and assign a policy to the account you created, and are using Exchange 2010, look up the corresponding information regarding policy creation and policy assignment when using the EMC (Exchange management console).
segment.target: Note If you want to create and assign a policy to the account you created, and are using Exchange 2010, look up the corresponding information regarding policy creation and policy assignment when using the EMC (Exchange management console).

segment.source: Go to the Exchange Admin Center.
segment.target: Go to the Exchange Admin Center.

segment.source: image showing exchange admin center.
segment.target: image showing exchange admin center.

segment.source: To create a mobile device mailbox policy, click Mobile from the left panel, then Mobile device mailbox policies.
segment.target: To create a mobile device mailbox policy, click Mobile from the left panel, then Mobile device mailbox policies.

segment.source: Surface Hubs require an account with a mobile device mailbox policy that does not require a password, so if you already have an existing policy that matches this requirement, you can apply that policy to the account.
segment.target: Surface Hubs require an account with a mobile device mailbox policy that does not require a password, so if you already have an existing policy that matches this requirement, you can apply that policy to the account.

segment.source: Otherwise use the following steps to create a new one to be used only for Surface Hub device accounts.
segment.target: Otherwise use the following steps to create a new one to be used only for Surface Hub device accounts.

segment.source: image showing using exchange admin center to create a mobile device mailbox policy.
segment.target: image showing using exchange admin center to create a mobile device mailbox policy.

segment.source: To create a new mobile device account mailbox policy, click the button from the controls above the list of policies to add a new policy.
segment.target: To create a new mobile device account mailbox policy, click the button from the controls above the list of policies to add a new policy.

segment.source: For the name provide a name that will help you distinguish this policy from other device accounts (for example, SurfaceHubDeviceMobilePolicy).
segment.target: For the name provide a name that will help you distinguish this policy from other device accounts (for example, SurfaceHubDeviceMobilePolicy).

segment.source: The policy must not be password-protected, so make sure Require a Password remains unchecked, then click Save.
segment.target: The policy must not be password-protected, so make sure Require a Password remains unchecked, then click Save.

segment.source: image showing new mobile device mailbox policy.
segment.target: image showing new mobile device mailbox policy.

segment.source: After you have created the new mobile device mailbox policy, go back to the Exchange Admin Center and you will see the new policy listed.
segment.target: After you have created the new mobile device mailbox policy, go back to the Exchange Admin Center and you will see the new policy listed.

segment.source: image showing new mobile device mailbox policy in exchange admin center.
segment.target: image showing new mobile device mailbox policy in exchange admin center.
